individualReformers.title: Key Individual Reformers (Quick Reference)
reformers: **Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar**: Widow Remarriage Act (1856); Sanskrit College; Bengali prose
**Keshab Chandra Sen**: Brahmo Samaj leader; women's education; Civil Marriage Act (1872)
**Pandita Ramabai**: Women's education; widow welfare; Arya Mahila Samaj
**Swami Vivekananda**: Ramakrishna Mission; Chicago speech (1893); Practical Vedanta
**Annie Besant**: Theosophical Society; Home Rule Movement; Congress President
**Gopal Krishna Gokhale**: Servants of India Society (1905); moderate reformer
**B.R. Ambedkar**: Dalit rights; Constitution architect; fought untouchability

examTips.critical: Raja Ram Mohan Roy = Brahmo Samaj (1828) + Sati abolished (1829); Dayananda = Arya Samaj (1875) 'Back to Vedas'; Vivekananda = Ramakrishna Mission (1897); Sir Syed = Aligarh Movement
examTips.acts: Sati Abolition (1829); Widow Remarriage Act (1856); Age of Consent Act (1891)
